thread.title: Junior varsity football team moves to 3-1
thread.title_full: Junior varsity football team moves to 3-1

author: news@mpnews.net (Staff)
title: Junior varsity football team moves to 3-1
text:
Junior varsity football team moves to 3-1 Oct 01, 2015 
BY ANDY KRUTSINGER 
Mt. Pleasant News 
DAVENPORT — The Mt. Pleasant junior varsity football team had their three-game winning streak snapped on Monday against Davenport Assumption, 54-13, one week after moving to 3-0 with a 26-0 win over Chariton. 
Against Chariton, the defense picked off three passes, one each by Colin Mulford, Reece McNamee and Keegan Rich, and stopped the Chargers from scraping together any points. 
The first two touchdowns of the game were big plays from the defense and special teams. Jake Lowe ran back a 57-yard punt return for a touchdown, and Mulford’s interception went 80 yards for a pick-six. 
With the score at 13-0, Damien Lorenzo caught a 44-yard touchdown pass from quarterback Zac Beason, and Mulford scored his second touchdown on a 10-yard reception that helped bring the score to 26-0. 
Offense was tough to come by against a talented Assumption team, but Beason did throw for 356 yards and two scores in the 54-13 loss. Reece McNamee, who also picked off a pass during the game, caught a 70-yard pass for a touchdown to open up the scoring, and Lorenzo caught one for 65 yards. 
Leading tacklers against Assumption were Dalton Bass (nine tackles, two assists), Caleb Potts (eight tackles) and Luke VanNyhuis (six tackles). 
The JV Panthers will be back at home this Monday, Oct. 5, when they take on Clear Creek-Amana at 5:30 p.m.
